title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition
notes: Only runs with launch option "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%". Works well except that the performance/framerate is really poor, like 20-30 FPS on a Vega 56 at 1080p. Quality setting in the game make almost no difference in performance.

title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition
notes:
On startup theres a black screen and a error box that says, "E_FAIL: IRender -> getDevice() -> createTextureID(&desc,NULL,&ptex)."
I think thats the same error I got in Monster Hunter which is normally very stable.  May be something specific to my system.

I also had to edit the launch settings to "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%" to get the game running. Otherwise it would crash with the error "E_FAIL: IRender -> getDevice() -> createTextureID(&desc,NULL,&ptex)."

The game runs fantastic in vanilla wine with dxvk at over 100fps.
On proton 3.7 it is currently at around 20-30fps like someone else here stated.
title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes:
The game only runs after forcing WINE's OpenGL-based D3D10 support with the launch option "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%". Somehow, the performance is even worse than it is in vanilla WINE- quite unplayable at least on Mesa.

Much worse than this, however, is that the HUD for Vergil and Trish causes the screen to turn black. Since the new playable characters are the main reason for choosing the Special Edition over DMC 4 Vanilla, this significantly hurts the game's playability.

Updating DXVK to a version that supports D3D10 or using DXUP may remedy these issues.
title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition

notes: The game only runs after forcing WINE's OpenGL-based D3D10 support with the launch option "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%". The game closes when you maximize the screen
title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition

notes: Update on the new proton 3.7-8 beta; forcing D311 is no longer necessary, and the game seems to run at full speed. Played for about half an hour until a crash.
title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition

notes: doesn't get past the start screen without a crash
title: Devil May Cry® 4 Special Edition
